definition: to destroy (by melting or burning)/to obliterate
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: Entry form will be destroyed before the commencement of next Music Festival.
sentences.chinese: 报名表将于来届音乐节开始前销毁。

sentences.english: The data will be used for specific purposes only, and all indentifiable information would be discarded after the conference.
sentences.chinese: 这些资料只用作特定的用途，并于活动完结后销毁。

sentences.english: It may be destroyed and recreated.
sentences.chinese: 它可能被销毁并重新创建。

sentences.english: They returned in turn to bury the luxuries burnt in the burst.
sentences.chinese: 他们顺次返返来埋躲在爆炸中销毁的豪侈品。

sentences.english: According to Thoman, food waste and yard waste are currently all dumped in a pile together.
sentences.chinese: 托曼说，此刻食物垃圾和庭院销毁物都堆放在一路。

sentences.english: Some 44 million antipersonnel mines have been destroyed from stockpiles.
sentences.chinese: 库存的杀伤人员地雷已有4400万个被销毁了。

sentences.english: Illegal weapons are set aflame in Nairobi, Kenya.
sentences.chinese: 在内罗毕非法枪支被销毁，肯尼亚。

sentences.english: An ordinary video camera can be confiscated and its tape destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 一架普通的摄相机可能被没收或磁带被销毁。

sentences.english: China has all along supported and advocated complete prohibition and thorough destruction of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 中国一贯主张并积极倡导全面禁止和彻底销毁核武器。

sentences.english: Whether to ask for confirmation when expunging appointments and tasks.
sentences.chinese: 销毁约会和任务时是否要求确认。

sentences.english: My bad habits must be destroyed and new furrows prepared for good seed.
sentences.chinese: 我的坏习惯必须销毁，新沟准备好种子。

sentences.english: The principle and merits of which thermite is used for combustion destruction of ammunition are expatiated.
sentences.chinese: 阐述了高热剂燃烧销毁弹药的原理和优点。

sentences.english: The marijuana he carried was confiscated and destroyed, according to police. (Chris Hondros/Getty Images)
sentences.chinese: 根据警方的消息，他携带的大麻被已没收和销毁。

sentences.english: Scope memory areas can be created and destroyed under programmer control.
sentences.chinese: 程序员可以控制作用域内存区域的创建和销毁。

sentences.english: Illegal firearms are displayed before being destroyed in Panama City.
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马城，非法枪支在销毁之前被摆在地上。

sentences.english: On the seventh day, I had to destroy those unsent letters which might serve as evidence of my crime.
sentences.chinese: 第七天，未寄出去的信，如犯罪的证据必须销毁。

definition: to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
to detain/to hold in custody/to distrain/to seize property
to sequester/to seal up (for safe keeping)/to freeze (an account)/to mothball
to detain/to arrest/to hold/to confiscate
to discard/to abandon
to tear up/to rip up/too shred
to smuggle
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
to remove/to take away
to transfer/to hand over
to intercept/to cut off and capture
to capture/to seize
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
to damage/to devastate/to vandalize/damage/destruction
meltdown/(of nuclear fuel) to melt down
